member.name: T:GosLib.Geo.Matrix
member.summary:
3D Matrix. The matrix is represented in the following row-vector syntax form:
[ m11 m12 m13 m14 ] [ m21 m22 m23 m24 ] [ m31 m32 m33 m34 ] [ offsetX offsetY offsetZ m44 ]
Note that since the fourth column is also accessible, the matrix allows one to represent affine as well as non-affine transforms. Matrices can be appended or prepended to other matrices. Appending A to B denotes a transformation by B and then by A - i.e. A(B(...)), whereas prepending A to B denotes a transformation by A and then by B - i.e. B(A(...)). Thus for example if we want to transform point P by A and then by B, we append B to A: C = A.Append(B) P' = C.Transform(P)
